NPCs may notice after they have been pickpocketed or stolen from, and will immediately accost their immediate suspect, usually the nearest person. If it is not the player, then the player has time to escape. However, in some cases where the player's reputation is bad enough, they may confront the player directly.

The player can pass a Speech check to bypass the confrontation. Otherwise, their inventory will be checked.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/i5z7KlW.png[/img]
Think twice about breaking the law. If you're seen, the knowledge will spread and everyone in the Hold will know you're a criminal. Bounties can be paid off, but damage to your reputation may never recover. While reputation is mainly tracked by Hold, rumors do cross Hold borders, so a poor reputation in one Hold may give you a bad impression in the rest of Skyrim. Impacts of a bad reputation include:

[list]
[*]Shopkeepers will be less willing to deal with you, greatly raising their prices.
[*]Fences may not care about your reputation, but they'll take advantage of the fact that you can't get a good deal anywhere else, moderately increasing their prices.
[*]Persuasion checks will be much harder to pass.
[*]Bribery will cost a bit more.
[*]Intimidation checks will be easier to pass, but will further decrease your reputation.
[*]You are more likely to be suspected of any thievery.
[/list][/size]
